alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 22 at 6:30PM CDT until March 22 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Tornado Warning for... South central Choctaw County in southwestern Alabama... Northwestern Washington County in southwestern Alabama... Northwestern Clarke County in southwestern Alabama... * Until 715 PM CDT. * At 630 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Fruitdale, or 12 miles southwest of Chatom, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Chatom around 645 PM CDT. Coffeeville around 710 PM CDT. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
